textBox.richText: From June 13 to June 18. I attended the IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR) in San Francisco. This was a success with 1800 participants, 18 tutorials/short courses and parallel sessions ( http://cvl.umiacs.umd.edu/conferences/cvpr2010 ). From the tutorials I attended, I had a preference for those ones: - “Learnings from founding a computer vision startup” by Till Quack (Kooaba AG, www.kooaba.com ) and Jan Erik Solem (Polar Rose www.polarose.com ). This tutorial was really a success with a lot of participants. In fact there was no seats left ! Slides are available online: http://www.vision.ee.ethz.ch/~tquack/cvpr10-tutorial.html . - “Mechanical Turk for Computer Vision” ( http://sites.google.com/site/turkforvision/ ) on own to outsource expensive and time consuming jobs such as image annotation. This was also a very interesting tutorial.
